text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the official Vietnamese press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

-- Planning and Investment Minister Do Quoc Sam has told the National Assembly the government is seeking to keep its budget deficit below 3.5 percent of Gross Domestic Product over the next five years.
-- Work has begun on an industrial park at Dung Quat in central Vietnam, the proposed site for a $1.4 billion oil refinery project.
-- Cao Si Kiem, Governor of the central State Bank of Vietnam, told the National Assembly on Tuesday that violations in the banking system are increasing despite tight controls.
-- The government has issued details about implementation of a new mining law, endorsed by the National Assembly in March.
-- Sugar cane plantations in southern Vietnam's Mekong Delta have been hit by flooding in the area. More than 34,870 hectares (86,160 acres) of cane has been seriously damaged.
